title: Dani Bondar
text:
Dani Bondar (; born 7 February 1987) is an Israeli former <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>.
Biography.
Bondar was born on 7 February 1987 in <a href="Moscow">Moscow</a>, <a href="Russian%20SFSR">Russian SFSR</a>, <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet Union</a>, and in 1990 went abroad to <a href="Israel">Israel</a> to <a href="Kibbutz">Kibbutz</a> <a href="Gazit">Gazit</a> in the <a href="Jezreel%20Valley">Jezreel Valley</a>. In Gazit, Bondar started his football career and played until the age of 12. After that he moved to Hakoah Afek. Today Bondarv plays in Hapoel Tel Aviv as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29%23Full-back">right back</a>.
Club career.
In the summer of 2006, Bondar moved up from the youth team to the first team of Hapoel by the team coach, <a href="Itzhak%20Shum">Itzhak Shum</a>. Despite his young age, Bondar played in <a href="UEFA%20Cup%202006-07">UEFA Cup</a> game against <a href="NK%20Dom%C5%BEale">NK Domžale</a> in the second qualifying round of the tournament.
On 17 June 2010, it was reported that Ukrainian side <a href="Zorya%20Luhansk">Zorya Luhansk</a> is interested in Bondar.
In August 2011 he signed with <a href="FC%20Volga%20Nizhny%20Novgorod">FC Volga Nizhny Novgorod</a>. He played there until he was released in January 2013.
He retired from football on 4 September 2014.
